title: Recent homes sales in Greater Boston (Feb. 25)
author: The Boston Globe
bullets: Recent sales in Boston included a high-rise condo at 1 Dalton St. for $14,000,000, the highest in the area.
A condo in Arlington at 30 Orvis Road #2 sold for $1,150,000, within Boston's competitive real estate market.
Notable sales in Belmont included a Colonial at 200 Claflin St. for $2,300,000, reflecting high property values.

title: How long will Mass. residents have to wait until their power is restored?
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Eversource and National Grid are restoring power after a blizzard left over 100,000 customers without electricity in Eastern Massachusetts.
About 94,000 National Grid customers lost power; 71,000 have been restored as efforts continue despite difficult weather conditions.
High winds up to 80 mph hindered repair efforts; crews pre-positioned on Cape Cod and Nantucket aid restoration.

title: 15 prospects Patriots fans should know entering the 2026 NFL Combine
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots have 11 picks, including 31st overall, in the 2026 NFL Draft.
Edge rusher and offensive upgrades highlighted as draft priorities, including players like Zion Young and KC Concepcion.
Patriots aim to add youth and depth, assessing prospects at the 2026 NFL Scouting Combine.

title: Malden school employee on leave after alleged ‘serious incident’ involving high school student
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: A Malden school employee is on leave following a 'serious incident' involving a high school student.
The employee, who works at the Linden STEAM Academy, was placed on leave as a precautionary measure.
Malden police are investigating the alleged incident, and no arrests or charges have been made.

title: These Mass. schools are closed for Wednesday, Feb. 25
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Massachusetts schools are closed for Wednesday, Feb. 25, due to a historic snowstorm that dumped three feet of snow.
School closures primarily affect districts on the South Coast and South Shore, which experienced the heaviest snowfall.
Notable closed districts include Attleboro, Plymouth, Weymouth, and Quincy; some have delayed openings like Canton and Wrentham.

title: MBTA to (mostly) resume normal weekday service after historic blizzard
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA to resume normal weekday service on all lines except Fall River/New Bedford Commuter Rail after historic blizzard.
Fall River/New Bedford line will operate on a modified schedule due to severe storm impact in the South Coast area.
MBTA advises commuters to plan for delays and exercise caution due to ongoing storm-related clean-up efforts.

title: Curran: Patriots could ‘explore options’ to potentially upgrade from Stefon Diggs
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots may explore options to upgrade from Stefon Diggs, whose 2026 cap hit is $26.5 million.
Diggs' future is uncertain, with $6 million guaranteed if on the roster by March 13, 2026.
Diggs had a strong season with over 1,000 receiving yards but faces potential contract restructuring and legal issues.

title: Mass. representatives, including minority whip, to skip State of the Union address
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Several Massachusetts representatives, including House Minority Whip Katherine Clark, announced they will skip the State of the Union address.
Rep. Ayanna Pressley plans to spend the day highlighting the impact of ICE detentions on immigrant children instead of attending the address.
Senator Ed Markey and others plan to attend a 'People’s State of the Union' rally to protest President Trump's policies and leadership.

title: Will Charlie McAvoy, Jeremy Swayman be back in Bruins lineup when they resume play Thursday?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy and Jeremy Swayman are uncertain to play for the Bruins against Columbus on Thursday.
McAvoy and Swayman are delayed due to weather after celebrating Olympic gold with Team USA.
David Pastrnak, Joonas Korpisalo, and Henri Jokiharju participated in Bruins practice on Tuesday.

title: Could Trent Williams suddenly emerge as a free-agent target for Patriots?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots may target Trent Williams if released by 49ers due to unresolved contract talks, says ESPN's Adam Schefter.
Williams, 37, is a five-time All-Pro with a 91.5 PFF grade, ranking third among NFL tackles last season.
If cut, 49ers face $34 million dead cap hit, which can be split over two years if after June 1, 2026.
